techmeme.title: Ilya Lichtenstein is sentenced to five years in prison for conspiring with his wife, Heather "Razzlekhan" Morgan, to launder money from the 2016 Bitfinex hack (Sabrina Willmer/Bloomberg)
OpenAI makes the ChatGPT desktop app for Windows available to all users, following an October release limited to paying ChatGPT subscribers (Michael Kan/PCMag)
Chinese autonomous driving company Pony.ai aims to raise $195M in its US IPO, targeting a valuation of up to $4.48B (Arasu Kannagi Basil/Reuters)
Sources: the US House Select Committee on China summoned Amazon staffers in September to discuss concerns about Amazon's shopping partnership with TikTok (Alexandra S. Levine/Bloomberg)
Anthropic is working with the US DOE's National Nuclear Security Administration to ensure Claude models don't share dangerous information about nuclear energy (Sam Sabin/Axios)
